item.title: Barcelona in 'advanced negotiations' to sign Ajax star Frenkie De Jong with midfielder close to £67m deal
item.description: The 21-year-old midfielder is said to be set to join the Catalan giants in a transfer worth in the region of £67million. De Jong, who has five Netherlands caps, is among the most wanted players in Europe.
item.content:encoded:
Barcelona are close to signing Ajax sensation Frenkie De Jong and could finalise a deal this week, according to reports in Spain.

The 21-year-old midfielder is said to be set to join the Catalan giants in a transfer worth in the region of £67million.

De Jong, who has five Netherlands caps, is among the most wanted players in Europe, with Paris Saint-Germain and Manchester City also keen.


According to Spanish newspaper AS, Barcelona have won the chase however, and will look to finalise the transfer in the next few days.

AS go as far to predict a confirmation date for the deal, with Saturday, January 12 reported being penciled in for Barca announcing the transfer.

It would bring to an end a months-long transfer saga surrounding De Jong, with some of the continent's biggest clubs courting the midfielder.

Ajax director of football Marc Overmars said before Christmas that Barca were favourites to sign De Jong, despite interest from PSG, City and Bayern Munich.

De Jong's agent Ali Dursun also revealed the midfielder's future would shortly be resolved.

'I think a decision will be made in the coming weeks,' he told Voetbal International. 'As such, he can focus on football in the month following the Christmas break.

'He needs to concentrate on that. He is fighting to win trophies with Ajax and the Dutch national team.'

item.title: Athletic Bilbao chief reveals club want to sign FOUR former players including Manchester United's Ander Herrera and Tottenham's Fernando Llorente
item.description: Manchester United are yet to renew Ander Herrera's contract and he will be available for free at the end of the season if he fails to put pen to paper on a new deal at Old Trafford.
item.content:encoded:
Athletic Bilbao want to bring back four of their former players, with Manchester United midfielder Ander Herrera at the top of their wishlist.

Herrera left the Spanish side for Old Trafford in a £29million deal in the summer of 2014 and has gone on to win the FA Cup, the League Cup and the Europa League.

However, United are yet to renew the 29-year-old's contract and he will be available for free at the end of the season if he fails to put pen to paper on a new deal.

That has alerted Bilbao, who are also keen on three more of their former players - Tottenham striker Fernando Llorente, Bayern Munich's Javi Martinez and Alaves winger Ibai Gomez.

The La Liga outfit only sign players who are from the Basque Country - an autonomous community in northern Spain - and are therefore limited when it comes to the players they can target.


'We are interested in Javi Martinez, Ibai Gomez, Ander Herrera, Fernando Llorente... we are interested in all of them,' sporting director Rafael Alkorta told Spanish radio station Cadena Ser.

'Any player who can represent Athletic (through their Basque roots) will interest us and players in that quality bracket interest us, so yes.

'We are aware none of these deals would be easy but we are interested in exploring the possibilities of what we can do.

'We have not made any moves yet but we will get to work this week and get going on these fronts.'

Like Herrera, Llorente and Gomez are out of contract this summer and would be able to rejoin their former club for free at the end of the season.

Martinez, however, is on a deal until 2021 at the Allianz Arena and is therefore likely to command a transfer fee.

item.title: ‘Can’t keep letting all this talent go’: Chelsea fans desperate for Callum Hudson-Odoi to stay after Bayern Munich make fourth bid for youngster
item.description: Chelsea fans have been venting their frustration at the possibility of Callum Hudson-Odoi moving to Bayern Munich. The 18-year-old is one of the brightest talents produced by the club's academy.
item.content:encoded:
Chelsea fans have been venting their frustration at the possibility of Callum Hudson-Odoi moving to Bayern Munich.

The 18-year-old is one of the brightest talents produced by the club's academy in recent years but he appears to be edging closer to the exit door.

Bayern Munich have matched Chelsea's £35million asking price with their fourth bid and plenty of Blues supporters fear the worst.

Hudson-Odoi has struggled to nail down a regular spot in Maurizio Sarri's first team but impressed in pre-season and whenever he has featured during the campaign.

And with Christian Pulisic still to arrive from Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season, the English winger might yet find himself further down the pecking order.

Given the time and effort put in by the Chelsea academy to help cultivate Hudson-Odoi's talents, fans appear to be widely condemning a sale.


One wrote that there would be 'no point' in the club even having an academy set up whilst another said that if the winger can't make it then nobody will.

Some lamented the waste of talent it would be to let Hudson-Odoi leave the club and join the growing number of English youngsters plying their trade in the Bundesliga.

Sarri also wants to keep hold of his promising starlet, saying: 'I don't think he should go to Germany because he is an English player.

'He is very young, he has the future and I think that he has a very great future here in England with the national team and with Chelsea. To stay here is better for him.'

item.title: Reading reject £450,000 offer from Wigan to sign former Manchester United defender Tyler Blackett
item.description: Wigan, recently taken over by Chinese investors, are keen to boost defensive options and replace Dan Burn, who was sold to Brighton in the summer but returned to spend the first half of the season on loan.
item.content:encoded:
Reading have rejected an offer of £450,000 from Wigan to sign their former Manchester United defender Tyler Blackett.

Wigan, recently taken over by Chinese investors, are keen to boost defensive options this month and replace Dan Burn, who was sold to Brighton in the summer but returned to spend the first half of the season back on loan at the DW Stadium.

They have identified Blackett who is versatile enough to operate in central defence or at left back as a top target but have now had three bids turned down by their Championship rivals.


The 24-year-old, after a difficult start to his career away from Old Trafford, has matured into a strong and athletic defender who has been in impressive form this season.

Middlesbrough and Stoke have also shown interest.

Reading are next to bottom of the Championship, six points behind Wigan with only 20 points from 26 games with new manager Jose Gomes at the helm.

Gomes has already started a clear out, with midfielder Pelle Clement released to link up with former Royals boss Jaap Stam at FC Zwolle in Holland's Eredivisie.

Dave Edwards has left the Madejski Stadium for Shrewsbury and young striker Ben House has joined Swindon on loan.

Reading have signed midfielder Ovie Ejaria on loan from Liverpool until the end of the season.

item.title: 'Tomorrow, we attack the Cup!': Real Madrid boss Santiago Solari says they must turn attentions to Copa del Rey after rocky return from winter break
item.description: Real finished 2018 with three successive LaLiga wins and victory in the Club World Cup but have found life difficult since returning from the winter break.
item.content:encoded:
Real Madrid coach Santiago Solari wants his stuttering side to be more clinical in attack as they attempt to belatedly get their 2019 up and running with victory over Leganes in the Copa del Rey.

Real finished 2018 with three successive LaLiga wins and victory in the Club World Cup but have found life difficult since returning from the winter break.

The European champions conceded a late equaliser to be held 2-2 at Villarreal last Thursday, and then on Sunday were humbled 2-0 at home by a Real Sociedad side who had not won a league match since November.


Those two league setbacks have left Madrid 10 points adrift of leaders Barcelona and, with the pressure starting to build, Solari is looking for a response in the Cup.

He told a press conference ahead of Wednesday's last-16 first leg at the Bernabeu: 'We will go out looking to win from the first minute and we will have to play similarly to how we did against Melilla (a 10-1 aggregate win in previous round).

'The Cup is very nice, we need to give it the attention it deserves from the opening minutes of the game.'

The former Madrid winger knows his side need to improve on recent performances, though.

He added, in quotes reported by the Spanish press: 'Tomorrow we attack the Cup. We will try to win it, as we try to go out to win every game.

'We are self-critical and we have to be more decisive in the final third of the pitch.

'We're looking to win a title. It's important to be focused from the start and be more convincing in the final third.'

Solari's side were without the injured Gareth Bale for the defeat by Sociedad and the Wales international found himself making headlines after being photographed apparently leaving the game in the second half when his side were 1-0 down.

When asked about the incident, Solari said: 'These things are resolved in private.'

Bale again looks set to be missing for the visit of Leganes while it remains to be seen if new signing Brahim Diaz will make his debut.

The Spain Under-21 international joined from Manchester City on Monday for an initial fee of £15.5million and trained with his new team-mates for the first time on Tuesday.

Solari said of the 19-year-old: 'He seems well to me, he's happy to be at Madrid. It (his being available to make his debut) will depend on the paperwork I imagine.'

Leganes travel to the Bernabeu sitting 16th in LaLiga and having been beaten 1-0 by Espanyol on Friday.

However, they were unbeaten in nine matches heading into that game.

Coach Mauricio Pellegrino said: 'There is something wonderful about football. It is not always the club with a bigger budget or more quality that wins, but the one who plays better in any given game.

He added on cdleganes.com: 'We go there with the aim of keeping the tie alive ahead of the second leg.'

item.title: Barcelona beat Manchester City to the free transfer of France U20s centre back Jean-Clair Todibo from Toulouse
item.description: The 19-year-old has impressed since making his Ligue 1 debut at the start of the season, and Barca have swooped with his contract coming to an end at the end of the season.
item.content:encoded:
Barcelona have confirmed the signing of France Under 20s centre back Jean-Clair Todibo, who will join from Toulouse when his contract expires in the summer.

The 19-year-old has impressed since making his Ligue 1 debut at the start of the season, and Barca have swooped with his contract coming to an end.

The move has created some conflict at Toulouse, who have dumped the player from the team in recent weeks, according to SPORT.


It is understood Toulouse were keen to sell the player to Manchester City, who were offering €4million for the player's services, but he has instead opted for Barcelona.

WHAT DO BARCELONA SAY ABOUT TODIBO?

'Todibo is a tall, right-footed defender who can play at centre back and also in the centre of the midfield. At the youth level he often featured in the middle of the field given his ability on the ball.

'One of his best qualities is his physical presence and his ability in the air. At just 19 years of age, the young talent comes to FC Barcelona as one of the most promising players in European Football in his position.'

The Nou Camp outfit are now said to be offering Toulouse a fee to sweeten the deal, in order to settle the matter with a friendly agreement.

Todibo will officially become a Barcelona player on July 1, a day after his Toulouse contract expires on June 30.

The centre back was born in Cayenne, the capital of French Guyana in South America on December 30, 1999.

He played for FC Les Lilas at youth level, before joining Toulouse in 2016. He made his first-team debut at the start of the season, and has made 10 starts in the time since.

He has represented France twice at Under 20s level, and also already has his first goal at senior level, netting away at Rennes at the end of September.

Todibo will join up with compatriots Samuel Umtiti and Clement Lenglet at the Nou Camp, also central defenders, as well as forward Ousmane Dembele/

item.title: 'Important teams in Europe want to sign our players because it's working really well': Man City boss Pep Guardiola believes Brahim Diaz's £22m sale to Real Madrid is a positive sign for the club's academy
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola believes Brahim Diaz's departure for Real Madrid is a sign of good work being done by the club. Academy product Diaz moved to the Spanish giants for £22m.
item.content:encoded:
Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola believes Brahim Diaz's departure for Real Madrid is a sign of good work being done by the club.

City had attempted to persuade the 19-year-old Spaniard to extend his contract with the club he joined aged 14, but admitted defeat this week and sold him to Madrid in a deal which could rise to £22million.

Asked if he was disappointed to lose Diaz, Guardiola said: 'No. I said many times, we did with Brahim the same we did with Phil (Foden) and Jadon (Sancho), we did absolutely everything but in the end the only one who decides to stay is Phil so that's all.

'We wish him all the best. Of course going to Real Madrid is not a bad step and hopefully he can get the minutes he didn't get in the last period for many reasons. Nice guy.

'On the other side, again, congratulations for our academy, they are working so well and in the end this is what happens, important teams in Europe want to sign our players because it's working really well.'

item.title: 'I trust the groundsman, I never made a phone call to say do this to damage our opponents': Pep Guardiola laughs off suggestions Man City altered their pitch before Liverpool win
item.description: There had been claims that City had allowed the turf to grow in a bid to hamper Jurgen Klopp’s slick countering. Club groundsman Lee Jackson blasted it as ‘the fakest of fake news’.
item.content:encoded:
Pep Guardiola scoffed at suggestions Manchester City tinkered with the Etihad Stadium grass before last week’s victory over Liverpool.

There had been claims that City had allowed the turf to grow in a bid to hamper Jurgen Klopp’s slick countering.

Club groundsman Lee Jackson blasted it as ‘the fakest of fake news’ and Guardiola poured cold water on the idea of gamesmanship.

‘I'm not the greenkeeper,’ Guardiola said. ‘I never did (ask), if they want to play quick, we want to play quicker.

‘Always we try to put water on the grass but it's not necessary here. We want to cut the field so it's better conditions for both teams, you do the best for opponents.

‘We have to respect them with the rules. I never speak with the groundsman. I have many issues to think about that.


‘I trust the groundsman, I never made a phone call to say do this to damage our opponents.’

Guardiola also confirmed that Benjamin Mendy is on schedule to return in the coming weeks after another knee injury.

The left back has been out since the Manchester derby on November 11 and has been plagued by injury concerns.

‘He's much better. He is training - not with the team - but maybe two or three weeks and he'll be with us,’ he said.

Guardiola launched an impassioned defence of City’s academy after Brahim Diaz became the latest product to move elsewhere.

Diaz has made the switch to Real Madrid in a deal worth an initial £15.5million but Guardiola is happy with how City are bringing youngsters through.

‘We did with Brahim the same as Phil and Jadon,’ he added. ‘We did absolutely everything. Hopefully he’ll get the minutes he wants and didn’t get in the last period for many reasons. He’s a nice guy.

‘But congratulations to the academy – the top teams in Europe want our players because they are doing well.

‘You have to take a look at the young players across Europe and how many are in the first team immediately. The young players need time.

‘David Silva was on loan before he came here and is what he is right now. Some players have patience, trust the club, and some don’t. Train with us, be with us. They then decide what is best for the guy.

‘We need to create a good second league and you’ll see how many players are in the Premier League. Play real teams against guys who are 25, 26, 27 years old. Every weekend, fighting to survive. Then the managers in the PL will have more courage.

‘Make a league that isn’t just in front of 10 people. They train with us, we loan them. On the pitch speaks for itself.’

item.title: Wales full-back Leigh Halfpenny set to miss the start of Six Nations campaign having not fully recovered from concussion sustained in autumn Tests
item.description: The Scarlets full-back has not played since suffering concussion during Wales' victory over Australia on November 10. Wayne Pivac reported that the player would not feature for 'three to five weeks'.
item.content:encoded:
Leigh Halfpenny looks set to miss the start of Wales' Guinness Six Nations campaign.

The Scarlets full-back has not played since suffering concussion during Wales' victory over Australia on November 10.

Halfpenny has seen a specialist, and Scarlets head coach Wayne Pivac reported on Tuesday that the player would not feature for 'three to five weeks'.


Wales' opening Six Nations game is against France in Paris in February 1, followed by an appointment with Italy in Rome eight days later.

Halfpenny, 30, went off late in the Australia match after being on the receiving end of a late challenge from Wallabies centre Samu Kerevi, who avoided any punishment.

He was selected to play for the Scarlets against Cardiff Blues 10 days ago, but was a late withdrawal after suffering headaches.

And Pivac has now revealed the outcome of 80-times-capped Halfpenny's further medical assessment.

WALES SIX NATIONS FIXTURES 2019

France

February 1, Paris

Italy

February 9, Rome

England

February 23, Cardiff

Scotland

March 9, Edinburgh

Ireland

March 16, Dublin

'Leigh has seen the specialist and won't be used for the next three to five weeks,' Pivac said.

'He will continue training and doing what he's been doing, and then he will be reassessed.

'It will be somewhere between three to five weeks, but these things take time. That's the time-frame we're looking at.

'Leigh won't play before that time, that will be the earliest. We will pass on the medical information to the Welsh Rugby Union.

'That will then be (Wales head coach) Warren's (Gatland) call as to what he does, because the tournament runs for longer than that.

'He's running, he's training, and from time to time I think he's been having bouts of (headaches).

'He's as frustrated as anybody is, but his health and well-being comes first.

'Lots of players have come back from it (concussion) before.

'Justin Tipuric and Aaron Shingler have had spells out, and both those players have returned to the top of their game at some point.

'There's no reason why that won't happen with Leigh.'

item.title: Ruben Neves has scored an incredible eight of his nine Wolves goals from OUTSIDE the box… our man watching him picks his top three scorchers
item.description: LAURIE WHITWELL: Ruben Neves made a spectacular return to form with a blistering goal to knock Liverpool out of the FA Cup on Monday night.
item.content:encoded:
Ruben Neves made a spectacular return to form with a blistering goal to knock Liverpool out of the FA Cup on Monday night.

The Portuguese midfielder has developed a reputation for scoring from range and this was his eighth strike from outside the box for Wolves. The only time he netted from inside the area was a penalty against Tottenham.

Neves has been instrumental in his team’s rise under Nuno Espirito Santo, setting the tempo in midfield and illustrating a vast array of passing, but his performances had dipped over winter as he adjusted to the top-flight.

BREAKDOWN: NEVES'S STRIKES FROM RANGE

1. Hull (a) W 3-2 37yds

2. Sheff Wed (a) W 1-0 27yds

3. Brentford (h) W 3-0 28yds

4. Sheff Utd (h) W 3-0 30yds

5. Cardiff (a) W 1-0 31yds

6. Derby (h) W 2-0 33yds

7. Everton (h) D 2-2 24yds

8. Liverpool (h) W 2-1 32yds

The 21-year-old was back to his best for the visit of Jurgen Klopp’s changed team, snapping into tackles and bringing great energy. His winner came from some 30 yards and was a bolt from the blue.

‘It’s something Ruben does and we encourage him to do,’ Nuno said. ‘Last season saw it often. We know he has this talent.

'It was a very important moment for us and the fans. We had just lost a goal and to react with such a beautiful goal, Molineux came alive again.’

Does it make a top three of Neves goals? Here, Sportsmail weighs them all up and decides…

3. Liverpool, January 7, 2019

There seemed little danger when Neves received the ball from Ruben Vinagre but he got it out of his feet quickly and let rip with a shot that kept low, cutting between James Milner and Xherdan Shaqiri, and swerved to beat Simon Mignolet at his near post.

The Belgian has been criticised at numerous points in his Liverpool career but on this occasion you have to applaud the strike. It travelled at such speed and was hit with such precision it is highly improbable any goalkeeper could have saved it.

It makes the top three for its importance as much as its quality. That it came against Liverpool, regardless of their changes, means something, and it also galvanised the home side soon after Klopp’s team had equalised to cap a memorable night.

2. Cardiff, April 6, 2018

This free-kick means his sublime first goal at Hull – a whirling blaster from way out – is nudged out, but the drama of this hit enhances its prominence. It was the winner in South Wales and placed Wolves on the precipice of promotion, inflaming tensions between Nuno and Neil Warnock after Cardiff missed two stoppage-time penalties.

Back to the goal: Neves took a short, straight run up but whipped the ball with great accuracy and velocity into the top corner, beyond the dive of Neil Etheridge.

It was pristine in its execution and we saw a similar technique when Neves scored past Jordan Pickford into the opposite corner on his Premier league debut.

1. Derby, April 18, 2018

One of the most gorgeous goals ever scored in the Championship and easily Neves’s best technically. Perched outside the Derby box for a Wolves corner, 33 yards out, the clearance came his way. His first touch sent the ball up in the air so he instinctively swept his right boot through it and it soared high then dipped into the top corner with great power.

Scott Carson would have had zero chance had he stood by the post and had a stepladder. Neves revealed afterwards that rather than setting himself up for the volley he had actually miscontrolled the ball so felt the imperative to shoot to avoid the threat of a counter attack.

‘It’s the first time as a manager I’ve almost applauded the opposition’s goal,’ Gary Rowett said. ‘I genuinely thought, what do you do about that? It is Champions League stuff.’

item.title: Manchester City's multi-millionaire stars arrive in their plush cars ahead of training as they prepare to face minnows Burton in Carabao Cup
item.description: Manchester City take on Burton Albion in the Carabao Cup semi-final first-leg on Wednesday night and their stars arrived at a training session on Tuesday in their plush cars.
item.content:encoded:
There are few teams in world football who possess more talent than Manchester City.

Their stars are regarded as some of the finest players on the planet and they picked up the silverware to match that last season, as they dominated domestic football in England.

They will have another opportunity to secure silverware in the Carabao Cup, which they have reached the final four of.


There will be a significant contrast when they line up at the Etihad Stadium on Wednesday night.

It will not be another set of Premier League icons facing them in the first-leg of the semi-final, but Burton Albion, who ply their trade in League One.

Even so, City's stars looked focused as they rocked up to the Etihad Campus on Tuesday afternoon.

Raheem Sterling, David Silva and Riyad Mahrez could all be seen driving into the training ground ahead of a session.

Bernardo Silva, who impressed against Liverpool last Thursday evening, and Danilo were also snapped on arrival on Tuesday.

Nicolas Otamendi drove in in a black Rolls Royce while Fernandinho was also snapped on his arrival.

Burton manager Nigel Clough urged his players to enjoy the game on Monday. 'We are going to enjoy the experience,' he said. 'Nobody gives us much of a chance and quite rightly so. But it's great for our supporters.

'Some have followed the club for 40, 50, 60 years or more and never dreamt of being in a League Cup semi-final so let's enjoy it.'

item.title: Padraig Harrington aims dig at Nick Faldo, defends Rory McIlroy and eyes wildcard cut as he's named Ryder Cup captain for 2020
item.description: The three-time major winner succeeds Thomas Bjorn, as Europe bid to defend the trophy. He was announced as captain at a press conference at the European Tour's Wentworth headquarters.
item.content:encoded:
Europe’s new Ryder Cup captain Padraig Harrington said more on his first day yesterday than many of his predecessors disclosed in six months.

If this is what he is dishing up on a ceremonial day filled usually with rah-rah cliches, the next 20 months should be compelling.

It was intriguing enough during the formal announcement when he became the first captain not to resort to blandishments such as ‘it’s an honour’, but admitted to a sense of ‘trepidation’ and feeling ‘daunted’ at the scale of the task.


What followed, though, was spellbinding, as one nugget followed another. For starters, he will be advocating a tweak to the qualifying system, with three wildcards instead of four.

He followed that with the revelation there will be no place for close friend Paul McGinley on his backroom team. There was a robust defence of Rory McIlroy after his controversial remarks about the European Tour being a ‘stepping stone’ to the PGA Tour, before a dig at Sir Nick Faldo’s captaincy in 2008.

As ever, each point was thoughtfully delivered, with plenty of humour, too. Asked whether there was any chance of him following in the footsteps of Thomas Bjorn and getting a tattoo done where the sun doesn’t shine, he replied: ‘I think it’s time we rear-ended that tradition, don’t you?’

Let’s start with McGinley. Such an inspirational skipper at Gleneagles in 2014, why wouldn’t you call on his wisdom as a vice-captain? ‘I will be relying on Paul, of course but not in an official capacity,’ said Harrington.

‘He doesn’t need to be coming back. I feel the job has moved on and it’s incumbent on the captain to bring players in as vice-captains who could be future captains. It’s too important a role now, and no longer a jolly, if it ever was.’

You might have thought he would get his feet under the table before tackling the qualification process but, again, he displays impeccable logic. ‘I’m having stats done to see if they back up what I feel anecdotally but I’m leaning to three picks instead of four,’ he said.

‘I find it hard to think how you would overlook the ninth player in the qualifying list, when you’ve got four picks, and my experience is that a player who finishes ninth feels more comfortable and has more belief in himself when he’s qualified rather than getting a pick.’

What about McIlroy — is it damaging to team morale when he is so disparaging about his home tour? ‘I read what Rory said but look at his actions,’ argued Harrington. ‘That man loves the Ryder Cup, and he gets so much from it that he can’t get anywhere else. He’s not 30 yet and he gets to be the leader in the team room. He gets the glory and the opportunity to be loved on the course.

‘He will be 100 per cent behind us, don’t worry about that. Yes, he’s moved to America, and his family is there. He wants to win the Masters, and so those words come out. But if you know the man behind the scenes, he’s as European as they come.’

Harrington appears such a natural fit, it comes as something of a shock to hear he wrestled long and hard before taking on the captaincy.

‘I can see it’s a natural progression after being a player on six occasions and a vice-captain three times, but it’s not something I’ve taken on lightly,’ said the 47-year-old Irishman.

‘Just because it might seem to be my time doesn’t mean I didn’t think deeply about it. There’s a certain trepidation because I really want to leave the Ryder Cup and the European Tour in a better place.

‘But I know as captain you’re putting it on the line and you’re great if you win or it’s your fault if you lose. It’s exciting but also daunting thinking I’m going to have to find an edge if we’re to beat a very strong American team on home soil.’

Underlining the scale of the task he has taken on in defending the trophy at Whistling Straits in Wisconsin next year, only once in the last 15 years has the away team won — and that needed a miracle at Medinah. To prepare, Harrington will call on the counsel of every captain from the last 20 years. Well, all but one.

‘Eight put their heart and soul into the job, so they will certainly be a help, while one did it half-heartedly, and that didn’t end so good,’ said Harrington.

Just in case anyone had doubts as to the identity of the miscreant, Harrington added: ‘It shows that just because you’re a successful player, it doesn’t mean you’ll be a great captain.’

It promises to be a revelatory 20 months, doesn’t it?

item.title: Timothy Weah poses with Celtic shirt alongside his mum and aunt at training camp in Dubai following loan move from Paris Saint-Germain
item.description: The eight-times capped United States international signed for Celtic from Paris Saint-Germain on Monday for the rest of the season and joined his new team-mates at their training camp in Dubai.
item.content:encoded:
Timothy Weah has posed with a Celtic shirt alongside his mum and aunt following his loan move from Paris Saint-Germain.

The eight-times capped United States international signed on Monday for the rest of the season and joined his new team-mates at their training camp in Dubai.

Weah, who is the son of former Milan star and current Liberian president George, was put through his paces on the training field on Tuesday and was also pictured holding up a Celtic shirt next to his mum and George's wife Clar Weah as well as his aunt Nancy Larnor.


The 18-year-old forward, whose dad won the Ballon d'Or in 1995, netted twice in six first-team appearances for Ligue 1 side PSG.

Manager Brendan Rodgers said on the club's official website on Monday: 'Timothy's a young talent who is full international player. He has a long career ahead of him but he has those natural attributes in terms of his pace and technique. He's hungry too.

'He's been in the PSG squad and featured for them in pre-season. With the quality of players they have, it's difficult for him to get in and get any game-time. They wanted him to go out on loan and saw Celtic as a great possibility.

'He has really good qualities technically, and tactically is always improving his game. Physically he's very good, very fast and is a strong player. He'll add competition to the squad.'

Before the winter break Rodgers' side were beaten by Old Firm rivals Rangers.

Celtic still sit top of the Scottish Premiership with a game in hand over Steven Gerrard's side.

The Hoops return to competitive action on January 19 when they welcome Airdrieonians in the Scottish Cup fourth round.

item.title: Manchester United stars have fun in the sun as boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer brings feel-good factor during Dubai training camp after misery under Jose Mourinho... and Paul Pogba's back too
item.description: Manchester United's squad appeared to have put the problems of Jose Mourinho's reign well and truly behind them as they trained in Dubai for the second time on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
Manchester United's squad appeared to have put the problems of Jose Mourinho's reign well and truly behind them as they trained in Dubai on Tuesday.

Interim boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, who has led his squad to five straight wins since replacing Mourinho last month, beamed as he made his way out for their second warm weather session of the trip.

The United legend was joined by Paul Pogba, who jetted out to join his team-mates after missing their flight to the Middle East to receive treatment on a thigh injury.


MANCHESTER UNITED'S NEXT SIX FIXTURES

January 13 - Tottenham (A)

January 19 - Brighton (H)(

January 26/27 - Arsenal (A), FA Cup

January 29 - Burnley (H)

February 3 - Leicester (A)

February 9 - Fulham (A)

*All games are Premier League unless stated

The Frenchman, who suffered a gash to his leg after a nasty challenge from Newcastle's Jonjo Shelvey, appeared to be back to full fitness as he tussled with full back Diogo Dalot.

Pogba was one of a number of players who fell out with Mourinho during his time at Old Trafford, but the mood appeared harmonious as Solskjaer continued his work alongside assistant Mike Phelan.

David de Gea, Chris Smalling and Ander Herrera were among those pictured training in the sun on Tuesday, a far cry from the winter of gloom United suffered under their former manager.

Players took part in a stretching session before working with the ball as they gear up for their return to Premier League action against Tottenham on Sunday.

Solskjaer revealed that defender Marcos Rojo has returned to Manchester for treatment, but gave more promising news on Pogba ahead of the trip to Wembley.

'Marcos [Rojo] has gone back home because his injury is taking a bit longer than we thought,' Solskjaer told the club's website.

'Fred['s partner] is expecting a baby and Paul [Pogba] has had his knock and has had a few days of treatment back home.

'Hopefully, we can get Paul on his feet during this week.'

United's upturn in form since Solskjaer took charge has been dramatic, with Saturday's 2-0 FA Cup win over Reading their fifth successive victory under the former Norway striker.

They jetted off for a four-day training camp in Dubai just hours after reaching the fourth round, but Solskjaer warned that the £350-a-night trip to the five-star One&Only Royal Mirage Arabian Court would not be a holiday.

'I've had plenty of time to speak with them but we haven't had plenty of time to train,' he said.

'It'll be a time to get some fitness work and work hard with them, so if any of the players think it's a holiday they're wrong.

'We're there to stick together, to work hard on the physical part of it and of course think ahead to the Tottenham game.'

item.title: Kylian Mbappe labels Lionel Messi AND Cristiano Ronaldo the ‘greatest of all time’ as he is named in FIFA 19 Team of the Year alongside them… but there is no room for PSG team-mate Neymar
item.description: Kylian Mbappe labelled both Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi as 'the greatest of all time' after being named in the FIFA 19 Team of the Year with both players.
item.content:encoded:
Kylian Mbappe labelled both Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi as 'the greatest of all time' after being named in the FIFA 19 Team of the Year with both players.

The 20-year-old's PSG team-mate Neymar failed to make the grade and Mbappe lavished praise on his more senior peers on Twitter.

He posted a tweet comprising solely of emojis, with a goat next to the Portuguese flag, another next to the Argentina flag and a baby face next to the French flag.

The young superstar attached a picture of the front three FIFA opted for. Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo were both rated 99 and Mbappe slightly lower at 97.

The 20-year-old Frenchman helped his country win the World Cup last summer and has enjoyed a stellar year.

Terrorising defences with his blistering pace and superb trickery, he is already repaying the massive £166million PSG signed him for from Monaco.


Messi and Ronaldo also dominated the football landscape over the last year, although Luka Modric claimed the Ballon d'Or.

The Croatian was an obvious selection in midfield for FIFA's Team of the Year and was picked alongside N'Golo Kante and Kevin de Bruyne.

A back four made up of Rafael Varane, Virgil van Dijk, Sergio Ramos and Marcelo were chosen in front of Manchester United and Spain star David de Gea in goal.

item.title: Bayern Munich make fourth bid for Callum Hudson-Odoi and match Chelsea's £35million asking price
item.description: The Bundesliga champions are very keen to sign the teenager, who is struggling for first team opportunities at Stamford Bridge. Hudson-Odoi has impressed for Chelsea this season.
item.content:encoded:
Bayern Munich have made a fourth bid of £35million for Callum Hudson-Odoi, matching Chelsea's required asking price.

The Bundesliga champions are very keen to sign the teenage forward, who is struggling for first team opportunities at Stamford Bridge.

Hudson-Odoi has impressed whenever he has featured for Chelsea this season, including assists for both goals in the 2-0 FA Cup win over Nottingham Forest.


However he is not a regular starter for Chelsea and with Christian Pulisic set to arrive from Borussia Dortmund next summer, his chances look likely to become even more scarce.

Bayern could offer a clearer route to first team action at the highest level, similar to Jadon Sancho, who has flourished at Dortmund after leaving Manchester City.

They had made three previous offers for the 18-year-old forward, worth up to £30m. Hudson-Odoi is keen on a move to Bavaria as he looks for more action.

Manager Maurizio Sarri however is ready to give Hudson-Odoi regular first-team football to keep him from Bayern's clutches.

'He is ready (to play more) I think. Of course we have very important players in the same position,' said Sarri.

'I can play with only two wingers I think but now he is ready. He can play, of course, some time he will be on the bench but same as Willian and Pedro.

'I can start to consider him on the same level. I don't think he should go to Germany because he is an English player. He is very young, he has the future and I think that he has a very great future here in England with the national team and with Chelsea. To stay here is better for him.'

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo shows off rippling six-pack after gym workout while on holiday in Dubai before returning to train with Juventus
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo returned to Juventus training on Tuesday morning ahead of Coppa Italia clash with Bologna after indulging in a Dubai winter break.
item.content:encoded:
Cristiano Ronaldo returned to Juventus training on Tuesday morning after indulging in a Dubai winter break.

On holiday with his family, including fiancee Georgina Rodriguez, the Portuguese held a hawk while wearing a Prada top.

The former Manchester United forward also found time to hit the gym and took to Instagram to show off his impressive physique.


Ronaldo will be preparing to return against Bologna in the Coppa Italia round of 16 on Saturday, which will be Juventus' first game back after the winter break.

The Serie A champions lead the league table by nine points and Ronaldo is looking to win many honours with his side this season.

'I don't work to break records, rather I work for the good of the club,' he told Record via Football Italia.

'2018 was the best year of my career. In Serie A they mark me as tightly as they do in Spain, but there's less space here because all the teams have excellent defences.

JUVE FIXTURES

12/01 - Bologna (A) - Coppa Italia last 16

16/01 - Juventus (N) - Supercoppa Italiana final

21/01 - Chievo (H) - Serie A

27/01 - Lazio (A) - Serie A

02/02 - Parma (H) - Serie A

'Winning the Champions League is a dream, but we mustn't make it an obsession. Team trophies count and I'm working to win them.

'Everyone in Turin welcomed me in a fantastic way. We're all feeling very good. I don't know when my career will end, but I'm fine and I want to keep going for many more years.

'Will I go back to Sporting like Nani? In football you never know... It was the right decision to leave the national momentarily, but I'll be back in 2019.'

item.title: Tammy Abraham TURNS DOWN Wolves loan and plans to stay at Aston Villa... but he would accept a permanent switch to Premier League
item.description: The Chelsea striker has impressed while playing for Aston Villa and is being coveted by a number of top flight sides during the January transfer window. It seemed Wolves had won race.
item.content:encoded:
Tammy Abraham has boosted Aston Villa by turning down a loan move to Wolves to stay at the Championship club.

The 21-year-old, who has hit 16 goals on loan from Chelsea, missed training on Monday as a move to Wolves developed. But Abraham returned to tell team-mates he was staying.

The striker appeared to change his mind after realising Chelsea were not prepared to sell him to Wolves. He did not wish to agree to another loan.

Wolves have not given up hope of landing Abraham, but their only chance is if Chelsea’s stance changes.

Abraham would have stood to increase his salary by moving to Wolves for the rest of the season but has decided to stay and help Villa win promotion.

There was always a risk that he would leave Villa Park, given that the agreement between Chelsea and Villa included a recall clause for this month.

Instead, another temporary switch does not appeal to the striker, who was capped twice by England in 2017 and regularly features for the Under 21s.


He would be open to the prospect of a permanent switch in this window, something teams in the Premier League would be willing to explore.

However, Chelsea are not keen to sell one of their most highly-rated young players despite Wolves previously suggesting they would be willing to pay around £18million for him.

Abraham could now feature for Villa when they visit Wigan Athletic at the weekend.
item.dc:abstract: Tammy Abraham has sensationally turned down a loan move to Premier League Wolves. The Chelsea striker has impressed while temporarily playing for Aston Villa and is being coveted by a number of top flight sides during the January transfer window. It seemed as though Wolves had secured his signature on loan, but it emerged on Tuesday that he has refused the move across the Midlands.

item.title: Police hunt for Chelsea fans 'who sexually assaulted female passengers and chanted racist songs' in front of families on train journey
item.description: Police are searching for a group of Chelsea fans who allegedly sexually assaulted female passengers and sung racist chants on a train service three days before Christmas.
item.content:encoded:
Police are searching for a group of Chelsea fans who allegedly sexually assaulted female passengers and sung racist chants on a train service days before Christmas.

The incident is said to have occurred following the Blues' 1-0 defeat by Leicester at Stamford Bridge, when up to 20 fans boarded a Great Western service at London Paddington bound for Worcester.

In a statement, British Transport Police said the fans began to chant racial abuse in front of families and young children, while also sexually assaulting a number of women on board the train.


They also urged women who had been sexually assaulted on the train but had not yet reported the incident to come forward to police.

A full statement read: 'On 22 December a group of around 20 football fans boarded the 6.22pm Great Western Service from London Paddington and began to chant racially abusive comments in front of families and children.

'They were also seen to sexually assault a number of women on board the train.

'It is believed they were Chelsea fans. The group, who were all men, left the train at Worcester.

'Officers are appealing for anyone who witnessed what happened to get in touch so they can assist the investigation.

'In particular, they believe a number of women who were sexually assaulted are yet to come forward and they would like to encourage them to do so.'

Chelsea fans have been under heavy scrutiny of late, following the alleged racial abuse of Manchester City and England forward Raheem Sterling last month.

The club have suspended four fans from matches pending a further investigation after a man was seen on TV allegedly calling Sterling a 'f****** black c***' during Chelsea's game against Manchester City.

Racist and antisemitic chanting was also heard at the Europa League clash against MOL Vidi, while some travelling fans were also photographed outside a bar in Budapest carrying a Chelsea Headhunters flag which featured a Nazi symbol.

In the aftermath of those incidents, club chairman Bruce Buck greeted fans in the away end at Brighton on December 16 to urge them to prevent any further episodes.

Anyone with information is asked to contact BTP by texting 61016 or calling 0800 40 50 40 quoting reference216 of 04/01/19.

item.title: Ki-Jana Hoever became Liverpool's third-youngest player against Wolves... but what happened to former starlets Jerome Sinclair and Jack Robinson?
item.description: Ki-Jana Hoever made history on Monday night when he became the third-youngest player to make his debut for Liverpool during their FA Cup third round defeat by Wolves.
item.content:encoded:
Ki-Jana Hoever made history on Monday night when he became the third-youngest player to make his debut for Liverpool during their FA Cup defeat by Wolves.

The talented defender, who replaced Dejan Lovren after just six minutes, also set a new record as the club's youngest player in the competition, having taken to the field at just 16 years and 354 days old.

Hoever sits behind only Jerome Sinclair (16 years and six days) and Jack Robinson (16 years and 250 days) in the list of Liverpool's youngest ever players, but where are the other two now after such bright starts to their careers?

JACK ROBINSON

Robsinson became the youngest player in Liverpool's history on May 9, 2010, when he came on as a late substitute during a Premier League game with Hull.

A product of the club's youth academy, Robinson had worked his way up the ranks after joining when he was just nine years old.

The Warrington-born left back was given a chance by Rafa Benitez in his last game as manager, but didn't get another first-team opportunity until April, 2011.

After coming off the bench in a draw with Arsenal, Robinson made his first start for the Reds in a 5-0 thrashing of Birmingham a week later.

ROBINSON'S CAREER

Clubs: Liverpool, Wolves (loan), Blackpool (loan), QPR, Huddersfield (loan), Nottingham Forest

Total appearances: 153

Goals: 4

He saw his chances further restricted following the signing of Jose Enrique that summer and made just two League Cup appearances during the 2011-12 campaign.

Six more appearances followed in 2012-13 before he was loaned to Championship outfit Wolves, where he played 11 times as the club were relegated.

Robinson spent the entirety of the 2013-14 season on loan at second tier Blackpool, making 34 appearances as the Tangerines finished 20th.


He eventually left Anfield permanently in the summer of 2014, joining QPR on a four-year contract before immediately signing for Huddersfield on loan.

Now an England Under 21 international, Robinson nailed down the left back spot at the John Smith's Stadium before a serious knee injury ended his season.

He returned to QPR in March 2015 and made just one appearance for the club the following season after finally fighting his way back to full fitness.

Only seven Championship appearances followed during the 2016-17 campaign, before he earned a regular spot, playing 34 times for the Rs last season.

Robinson scored his first two senior goals during an away victory at Birmingham in December, 2017, but declined a new contract at Loftus Road, instead joining Nottingham Forest on a free transfer last summer.

The defender has so far made 25 appearances for Aitor Karanka's side, who are seventh in the Championship table and pushing for promotion.

JEROME SINCLAIR

Sinclair usurped Robinson as Liverpool's youngster-ever player on September 26, 2012, when he came off the bench during a League Cup win over his former club West Brom.

The pacey winger began his career with the Baggies, coming through their academy before joining Liverpool as a 14-year-old in 2011.

He continued his development with the club's youth sides, impressing enough to be called up to Brendan Rodgers' senior squad for the game at the Hawthorns.

SINCLAIR'S CAREER

Clubs: West Brom (youth), Liverpool, Wigan (loan), Watford, Birmingham (loan), Sunderland (loan)

Total appearances: 35

Goals: 4

Sinclair came on in the 81st minute of the 2-1 victory, but did not play for the first team for the rest of the season or during the entire 2013-14 campaign.

He went on loan to Championship side Wigan in March 2015 but made just one appearance before returning to make his Premier League debut as a substitute during a draw at Chelsea on May 10.

Sinclair, who represented England at Under 16 and 17 level, played his first game of the 2015-16 season against Exeter in the FA Cup, scoring his first goal in a 2-2 draw.

Liverpool rejected a bid of £1.5million from Watford for the winger in the same month and shortly afterwards he agreed to join them on a free transfer when his contract expired at the end of the season.

The Hornets were forced to pay compensation of £4m for Sinclair, who eventually made his debut for the club in December, 2016.

He went on to make six appearances before being sent on loan to Birmingham in January, 2017, and played a further five games for the Championship side.

Sinclair managed just 27 minutes of Premier League football for Watford last season and was deemed surplus to requirements by boss Javi Gracia last summer.

The 22-year-old joined League One side Sunderland on loan this season and has already made 18 appearances, scoring twice so far.

Hoever sits behind only Jerome Sinclair (16 years and six days) and Jack Robinson (16 years and 250 days) in the list of Liverpool's youngest ever players, but where are the other two now after such bright starts to their careers?

item.title: 'We won't go into detail about their players as that will frighten the life out of our lads': Burton manager Nigel Clough admits chances of progressing against Man City are extremely slim
item.description: Burton got a stark reminder of the size of the task facing them when Rotherham went to the home of the Premier League champions in the FA Cup on Sunday and suffered a 7-0 thrashing.
item.content:encoded:
Nigel Clough admits he has kept back information on Manchester City to avoid frightening the life out of his Burton squad.

Manager Clough admits the club’s chances of progressing are extremely slim and has told players and fans to enjoy the occasion of a Carabao Cup semi-final.

League One Burton have an annual wage bill 87 times smaller than Pep Guardiola’s squad and Clough, whose side have beaten Aston Villa, Burnley, Nottingham Forest and Middlesbrough to reach this point, accepts City represent a daunting task.


Clough said: ‘I watched them play Liverpool and their work-rate and ability all over the pitch was there for everybody to see. They also have strength in depth, not just on the bench but below that.

'They have the best youngsters in the country, so whichever team they play has quality. Every game you have a chance but it’s just about what degree that chance is. Ours is extremely slim.

‘We won’t go into detail about their players as that will frighten the life out of our lads. They know how good Man City are because they watch Match of the Day every week.’

CARABAO CUP SEMIS

Jan 8: Tottenham v Chelsea (8pm)

Jan 9: Man City v Burton (7.45pm)

Jan 23: Burton v Man City (7.45pm)

Jan 24: Chelsea v Tottenham (7.45pm)

Clough added: ‘Nobody gives us much of a chance and quite rightly so. But it’s great for our supporters. Some have followed the club for 40, 50, 60 years or more and never dreamed of being in a League Cup semi-final, so let’s enjoy it.

‘We will approach it the same way we have when we have faced Championship clubs and Premier League Burnley in the competition this season. We also can’t do too much work on them as we have no idea what team they will play — and that helps in some ways.

‘We will just focus on ourselves, do our jobs and hope City have a terrible night. For something to happen in our favour, they will have to have an off night.’

Clough was a boy when his dad Brian won the League Cup with Nottingham Forest as a manager in 1978 to begin a glorious period for the club and he is pleased to have added to his family’s history.

‘It was one of the first things that Forest won in the late 1970s, beating Leeds in the semi-final over two legs, then Liverpool in the final after a replay,’ he said. ‘It kick-started Forest’s belief and it all went from there.’

Clough was Burton manager in 2006 when his team, then in the Conference, held Manchester United 0-0 at home in the FA Cup. But he believes the task against City is a harder proposition.

‘The gulf between the top teams and the third tier is massive now,’ Clough said. ‘When Wayne Rooney and Cristiano Ronaldo came on after 59 minutes for United, it’s a similar sort of prospect with the likes of the quality City have.’
item.dc:abstract: Burton manager Nigel Clough wants to make sure his players remember to enjoy the occasion when they face Manchester City in the semi-finals of the Carabao Cup on Wednesday. League One Burton got a stark reminder of the size of the task facing them when Championship side Rotherham went to the home of the Premier League champions in the FA Cup on Sunday and suffered a 7-0 thrashing. Clough, who finished his senior playing career at City when times were very different for the Manchester club, is determined to savour the moment even if the odds are stacked against them.

item.title: Kane messing with Luiz's head again, Tottenham targeting Jorginho, and Chelsea finally feeding Morata: The key battles where the Carabao Cup semi-final will be won and lost
item.description: JOE BERNSTEIN: Tottenham thumped Chelsea 3-1 at Wembley less than seven weeks ago, but the stakes for Spurs are arguably even higher now. Here are five key areas of the game.
item.content:encoded:
Tottenham thumped Chelsea 3-1 at Wembley less than seven weeks ago when Maurico Pochettino won the tactical battle against Maurizio Sarri, with Dele Alli stifling Jorginho and scoring the opening goal as well.

The stakes for Spurs are arguably even higher in the first leg of their Carabao Cup semi-final, given that the north London club are trophyless since 2008.

Sportsmail takes a look at five areas where the game could be won and lost.


WILL THE 'OLD KANTE' STOP DELE?

Playing the world's finest holding midfield player, N'Golo Kante, further forward to accommodate the more technically-gifted Jorginho at the base of a 4-3-3 has generally worked well for Sarri.

But against better opposition, and Spurs must be included in that list, the risk is that Chelsea's midfield can be over-run without Kante there to spot danger. Spurs put Alli on Jorginho to hassle the Italy international at Wembley and it worked a treat.

Jorginho completed only 43 passes all afternoon, his lowest tally of the season, and Alli's energy also allowed him to be an attacking threat, scoring the first goal with a header from a set-piece. Jorginho has made more accurate passes than any player in the Premier League this season – 1,896 – but there is a case for putting Kante in that position for this game because of his superior athleticism.

Sarri doesn't like change though. 'I want to play a central midfielder who is a very technical player, so for me that's Jorginho,' he said in the wake of November's loss. Spurs will hope he keeps the same system so that Alli can do the same job.

Alli has scored a goal per game against Chelsea in recent times while Jorginho was a broken man by the time Son Heung-min sprinted past him for Tottenham's third goal.

FEED MORATA AND HE WILL SCORE

It was former Chelsea great Ruud Gullit who backed the struggling Alvaro Morata earlier this season by pointing out his team-mates weren't playing to his strengths.

The preference of Eden Hazard and Willian to always cut inside meant Morata wasn't getting the service he craved in the penalty area. He was substituted after just 58 minutes of the defeat at Spurs on November 24 and at that stage had managed just six goals all season, a poor return for a £60million centre forward.

The introduction of a quick and direct winger in Callum Hudson-Odoi against Nottingham Forest in the FA Cup on Saturday suggests Gullit may have been right. The 18-year-old Bayern Munich target twice got to the byline and crossed as soon as he could, where Morata finished with aplomb on both occasions.

There is a strong case for Hudson-Odoi to supply the bullets for Morata again at Wembley but it's a big call for Sarri. If fit, Olivier Giroud, who scored as a sub against Spurs last time, offers an alternative of holding the ball up for Hazard and either Pedro or Willian to run onto. Hazard likes playing with Giroud.

THE ERIKSEN AXIS

It's no wonder Spurs fans are nearly as alarmed about Barcelona and Real Madrid interest in Christian Eriksen as they are in losing their manager, Mauricio Pochettino.

The wide open spaces of Wembley are a godsend to someone with the Denmark international's range of passing. With Harry Kane, the in-form Son and Alli around him, Eriksen has options on the ball, and invariably picks the right one.

If Pochettino gives him a free role in the Carabao Cup semi-final first leg, the second leg might be academic based on Eriksen's performance against Chelsea earlier in the season.

On that occasion, Eriksen was instrumental in Tottenham's 3-1 victory; his free-kick saw Alli head the opening goal; his pass for Kane led to the second; he set up several other chances as Chelsea's defence wobbled.

If Tottenham can dominate possession, Pochettino will try to devise a system that allows Eriksen to do maximum damage. Full backs Kieran Trippier and Danny Rose will provide width and Kane is becoming adept at finding pockets of space outside of the orthodox centre forward's position.

Pochettino will also be delighted Son's departure for the Asian Cup has been delayed until after this game. The South Korean has scored seven goals in his last six games.

CAN TRIPPIER HALT HAZARD?

After a World Cup that catapulted him to genuine stardom, Trippier has suffered something of a hangover this season. He has suffered niggly injuries, hasn't scored a goal since August and been defensively more vulnerable than in previous seasons.

Having said all that, it would be a huge gamble for Pochettino to leave out the 28-year-old in favour of Serge Aurier, particularly as the Tottenham right back has the duty to stop Chelsea's best player, Hazard.

Aurier has blistering pace but Hazard's strength is his close control, the ability to manouevre the ball in tight areas, and his strength in shrugging off challenges once he's on the move. In that respect, Trippier is better equipped to stop the Belgian than most.

Pochettino will also encourage Trippier to get forward, dragging Hazard back into areas where he can't be dangerous. If Hazard foregoes his defensive duties, Trippier can deliver the type of crosses towards Kane that Sarri won't want to see.

PROBABLE TEAMS

Tottenham: (4-2-3-1) Gazzaniga; Trippier, Sanchez, Alderweireld, Rose; Winks, Sissoko; Son, Eriksen, Alli; Kane

Chelsea: (4-3-3) Kepa; Azpilicueta, Luiz, Rudiger, Alonso; Kante, Jorginho, Barkley; Pedro, Giroud, Hazard

KANE MESSES WITH LUIZ

The strangest sight of the last Tottenham-Chelsea game was the sight of David Luiz deliberately getting out the way of Kane's shot from 20 yards, presumably to avoid a deflection.

Unfortunately, his goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga was anticipating it, and as Luiz swerved like a matador pulling away the cape, Kane's shot ended up in the back of the net without fuss. It summed up Luiz's afternoon, the Brazilian having his poorest performance of the season at Wembley.

That's the aura Kane carries with him these days, even against experienced defenders. Kane, the World Cup Golden Boot winner and joint-highest Premier League scorer this season, was described as an 'icon of English football' by Pochettino last week and he's already adapting his game because of the close attention he receives on the pitch.

Far from just being a No 9 target man, Kane has dropped back as a No 10 at times this season, allowing the pace of Lucas Moura or Son to hurt defences ahead of him.

Besides his own scoring record, Kane has also created six goals this season – more than his toal of assists for last season.

When he drops a little deeper outside the penalty area, he's capable of making a killer pass, which gives Luiz and his defensive partner Antonio Rudiger the dilemma of whether to hold their line or follow the England captain.

item.title: Sir Alex Ferguson set to manage Manchester United legends team against Bayern Munich in repeat of iconic 1999 Champions League final
item.description: Sir Alex Ferguson is poised to reprise his role as Manchester United manager in a repeat of the iconic 1999 Champions League final against Bayern Munich in May.
item.content:encoded:
Sir Alex Ferguson is poised to reprise his role as Manchester United manager in a repeat of the iconic 1999 Champions League final against Bayern Munich in May.

The Nou Camp 20 years ago played host to one of the most famous nights in United's steeped history when Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, now in the post which Ferguson held for 26 years, turned home a late, late winner to secure a stunning treble.

And now, according to The Sun, United are trying to organise a reboot of that tie, which United eventually won 2-1, on May 26 this year – exactly 20 years to the day.

United and Bayern both hope to lure back as many players as possible to play the exhibition match – and it is claimed Ottmar Hitzfeld is likely to be in the opposing dugout once again.


Ferguson, who won 38 trophies during his tenure as boss at Old Trafford, has been approached about taking the reins once again.

The Scot, 77, suffered a brain haemorrhage last May but has made steady progress in recovery.

He has resumed his role as a club director and ambassador and it is understood he has agreed to take on the role in the reprise of the 1999 final should he be in good health.

Solskjaer, the hero on that night in Barcelona, has made an incredible start to life as manager of Manchester United – winning his first five games in charge by a margin of two goals or more.

The Norwegian invited his former boss to the United training complex over the festive period and The Sun claim Ferguson had some inspiring words for the players.

The United great will have to channel that once again come May should he inspire his class of 99 to another victory over a star-studded Bayern squad.

In that famous final, United fell behind early to a Mario Basler free-kick, which wrong-footed Peter Schmeichel in goal.

And after 91 painful minutes for the Red Devils, it was the substitutes who did the damage – both from David Beckham corners.

Teddy Sheringham turned home Ryan Giggs' scuffed shot in the 91st minute before Solskjaer completed the emphatic turnaround when he poked home just two minutes later, sending the United faithful into delirium.

It is also understood the referee from that night, the legendary Pierluigi Collina, has also been asked about reprising his role for the Old Trafford re-run in May.

CHAMPIONS LEAGUE FINAL 1999

MANCHESTER UNITED: Peter Schmeichel (c), Gary Neville, Ronny Johnsen, Jaap Stam, Denis Irwin, Ryan Giggs, David Beckham, Nicky Butt, Jesper Blomqvist (Teddy Sheringham 67'), Dwight Yorke, Andy Cole (Ole Gunnar Solskjaer 81')

Substitutes not used: Raimond van der Gouw, David May, Phil Neville, Wes Brown, Jonathan Greening

Manager: Sir Alex Ferguson

Bookings: None

Goals: Sheringham 90+1, Solskjaer 90+3

BAYERN MUNICH: Oliver Kahn (c), Lothar Matthaus (Thorsten Fink 80'), Markus Babbel, Thomas Linke, Samuel Kuffour, Michael Tarnat, Stefan Effenberg, Jens Jeremies, Mario Basler (Hasan Salihamidzic 87'), Carsten Jancker, Alexander Zickler (Mehmet Scholl 71')

Substitutes: Bernd Dreher, Thomas Helmer, Thomas Strunz, Ali Daei

Manager: Ottmar Hitzfeld

Bookings: Effenberg

Goal: Basler 6

Referee: Pierluigini Collina

Attendance: 90,245

WHERE ARE THEY NOW?

Manchester United

Peter Schmeichel: Appears as a pundit on BBC and has taken up the same role on Danish TV with more regularity.

Gary Neville: A stalwart of Sky Sports football shows, undertaking punditry and commentary roles. He also part-owns Salford City.

Ronny Johnsen: Following his retirement from football in 2008, he is now an ambassador for Manchester United.

Jaap Stam: Current manager of Dutch side PEC Zwolle following his stint as Reading boss.

Denis Irwin: Presenter for Manchester United's in-house TV channel MUTV.

Ryan Giggs: Current manager of the Wales national football team. Also part-owns Salford City.

David Beckham: In the process of setting up his own MLS franchise, which is named Inter Miami.

Nicky Butt: Manchester United academy coach. Also part-owns Salford City.

Jesper Blomqvist: Now resides back in Sweden and last year opened a pizza restaurant in Lidingo, an island near capital city Stockholm.

Dwight Yorke: An ambassador for Manchester United and occasional Sky Sports pundit.

Andy Cole: Ambassador for Manchester United.

Teddy Sheringham: Most recently managed ATK in the Indian league.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer: Current manager of Manchester United, on loan from Molde.

Bayern Munich

Oliver Khan: Often features as a pundit on German TV.

Lothar Matthaus: TV pundit in many countries such as Brazil, Iran and occasionally in the UK.

Markus Babbel: Current manager of Western Sydney Wanderers in the Australian A-League.

Thomas Linke: Current adviser at Ingolstadt in the German second tier.

Samuel Kuffour: Has done little since retiring from playing in 2010 but has attempted to get back into the administration side of football in Ghana.

Michael Tarnat: Current youth team coach at Bayern Munich.

Stefan Effenberg: Most recently sacked as manager of SC Paderborn, sometimes appears as a pundit on German TV.

Jens Jeremies: Works at global sports company IMG with his former agent, Juergen Milewski.

Mario Basler: Currently works as sports director at 1.FC Lokomotive Leipzig.

Carsten Jancker: Currently manages SV Horn in the Austrian second division.

Alexander Zickler: Current youth team coach at Red Bull Salzburg.

Thorsten Fink: Manages Swiss side Grasshoppers.

Hasan Salihamidzic: Currently working as sporting director for Bayern Munich.

Mehmet Scholl: Appeared on TV channel ARD and most recently managed Bayern Munich II in 2013.

*Only players who featured in the 1999 Champions League final

item.title: Brahim Diaz trains with Real Madrid stars for the first time after £22m move from Manchester City
item.description: Day one of a six-and-a-half-year project to become a Real Madrid star - Brahim Diaz has trained with his new team-mates for the first time after his big-money move from Manchester City.
item.content:encoded:
Day one of a six-and-a-half-year project to become a Real Madrid star - Brahim Diaz has trained with his new team-mates for the first time.

Diaz completed a £22million move from Manchester City to the Bernabeu on Monday, and on Tuesday was put through his paces at Real's Valdebebas facility.

He made the switch after being limited to just 414 minutes of senior football at City since joining from Malaga in 2013 aged 14, including 49 minutes of Premier League action.


However Real clearly regard the 19-year-old as a huge potential talent, and he was immediately involved with the first team after his big-money move.

The new Real No 21, who will earn £60,000 per week, said he has no doubts after swapping one European heavyweight for another, despite the likely lack of first-team chances in the short term.

At his Monday unveiling, he said: 'I had three options after deciding to leave Manchester City. One, play at Real Madrid, two, play at Real Madrid and three, play at Real Madrid. It was impossible to go anywhere else.'

Diaz will take inspiration from another teenage attacker, 18-year-old Vinicius Junior, who has made an impact on the Real first team this season.

Vinicius was among the Real stars pictured in training in the January sunshine, along with Luka Modric, Isco, Marcelo and others.

Diaz could get a chance if manager Santiago Solari wants to switch things up, with Real making an inauspicious restart after the winter break.

They drew 2-2 at Villarreal on January 3, before being beaten 2-0 at home by Real Sociedad on Sunday. They host Leganes in the Copa del Rey on Wednesday before visiting Real Betis in the league at the weekend. Real are currently fifth in La Liga, 10 points behind leaders and rivals Barcelona.

item.title: Kyle Edmund gets a birthday surprise at Australian Open when he's handed a cake to help celebrate turning 24 as he practises with Roger Federer
item.description: World No 3 Roger Federer could be seen in the background of the clip and shortly after posting the video Edmund uploaded a picture of himself with the reigning Australian Open champion.
item.content:encoded:
Kyle Edmund received a surprise cake at the Australian Open as he celebrated his 24th birthday on Tuesday.

The British No 1 uploaded a video of him being given the birthday cake on to Twitter.

The caption read: 'Big thanks to Craig and his team at the @AustralianOpen for my surprise! Thanks for all the birthday messages.'

Big thanks to Craig and his team at the @AustralianOpen for my surprise! Thanks for all the birthday messages 🎂 pic.twitter.com/ygzV8ApJhD

— Kyle Edmund (@kyle8edmund) January 8, 2019

KYLE EDMUND'S GRAND SLAM RECORD

Australian Open: Semi-final

French Open: Third round

Wimbledon: Third round

US Open: Fourth round

World No 3 Roger Federer could be seen in the background of the clip and shortly after posting the video Edmund uploaded a picture of himself with the reigning Australian Open champion.

Alongside the photo, Edmund wrote: 'Good days work down under, cheers @rogerfederer.'

Federer replied to Edmund's Tweet later on Tuesday, writing: 'Was a good practice indeed, Thanks for the hit. Happy birthday.'

Edmund is gearing up for the first Grand Slam of the year, which begins on Monday.

He suffered a shock straight-sets defeat at the Brisbane International last week.

The Brit lost to qualifier Yasutaka Uchiyama, ranked 185 in the world, 7-6, (8/6) 6-4 last Wednesday.

The draw for the Australian Open will be held on Thursday.

item.title: That's a Smart look! NBA star hopes to channel luck of the Irish as he reveals new hairdo in Boston Celtics game
item.description: They may not wear a big shamrock on their chests but the Boston Celtics have a clear association with the famous Irish symbol. A white shamrock sits on a green cirlce in their official logo.
item.content:encoded:
They may not wear a big shamrock on their chests but NBA side Boston Celtics have a clear association with the famous Irish symbol. A white shamrock sits on a green cirlce in their official logo.

And they now have a player who is wearing the shamrock with pride — and in an unusual place.

During the game against the Brooklyn Nets on Monday evening, Marcus Smart unveiled his new hairstyle that pays tribute to his team.


Smart has managed to get the shamrock weaved into his hair as he continues his habit of having impressive looks in his hair.

He also managed to get the number 36, which he wears on the back of his shirt, at the front of the style.

However, he is not the first Boston Celtics player to go as far as having the shamrock designed into his hairdo.

Gerald Green, now of the Houston Rockets, wore a shamrock in his hair when he was playing for the Celtics in 2016.

Speaking after the game, Smart revealed that Green had played a part in inspiring his look.

'It took about 50 minutes. Shout out to Jaws, her name is Jaws, she's the best braider in the country,' Smart said.

'Gerald kind of inspired it,' added Smart. 'He inspired me to get the shamrock and you know we added a little flavour with the 36.'

item.title: Now you see me, now you don't... fans left baffled as Xherdan Shaqiri seems to vanish inside Jurgen Klopp's coat after FA Cup defeat at Wolves
item.description: Jurgen Klopp is known for his bear hugs after matches but his embrace with Xherdan Shaqiri after Liverpool's defeat by Wolves was a biazarre one.
item.content:encoded:
Jurgen Klopp is known for his bear hugs but his embrace with Xherdan Shaqiri after Liverpool's defeat by Wolves was a biazarre one.

The diminutive winger played the whole game but could not help the Reds avoid a 2-1 defeat in their FA Cup tie at Molineux.

After Klopp walked onto the pitch to console his players, he wrapped his arms around Shaqiri, who then suddenly vanished behind him.

Scroll down for video...

The televisual illusion almost made it look like the 27-year-old had slipped inside the large black coat Klopp was wearing.

A number of fans reacted on social media after the baffling clip was shared.

Some used Harry Potter gifs, another joked that Klopp absorbed players to become powerful and one even noted how Fabinho comes out of the picture behind Klopp in an instant following Shaqiri vanishing.


Clearly, given his 5ft 5in frame compared with the German standing at 6ft 4in, it's easy to see how Shaqiri could be blocked out of shot for so long.

Perhaps the trick of the camera offered a welcome distraction for Liverpool fans who had seen their side dumped out of the FA Cup.

Ruben Neves sealed the win for Wolves with a rocket from 30 yards after Divock Origi had cancelled out Raul Jimenez's opener.

... did Shaqiri just disappear into Klopp’s coat? pic.twitter.com/qZRYyRZdvF

— Lewis (@lewisgilbert97) January 7, 2019

item.title: Crystal Palace offload out-of-favour striker Alexander Sorloth to Gent on loan - just one year on from £9million move to Selhurst Park
item.description: Crystal Palace are sending out-of-favour striker Alexander Sorloth to Belgian side Gent on loan, just a year after his £9million move to the Premier League.
item.content:encoded:
Crystal Palace are sending out-of-favour striker Alexander Sorloth to Belgian side Gent on loan, just a year after his £9million move to the Premier League.

The Norwegian striker has scored just one goal for Palace, in the Carabao Cup against Swansea, and his game-time this season has been severely limited.

The return of Connor Wickham to full fitness only pushes Sorloth further down the pecking order, and he is now heading for a short-term loan spell in Belgium.


Sorloth boarded a flight to Benidorm from Gatwick Airport on Tuesday morning, where he will meet up with his new team-mates during their winter training camp.

There is no option to buy in the deal, and Palace will be hopeful that Sorloth can find some form before returning to south London at the end of the season.

The 23-year-old becomes the fourth player to leave the Eagles in the January window, following Jordon Mutch, Jonny Williams and Jason Puncheon out of the exit door.

Mutch had his contract terminated following a loan spell at Vancouver Whitecaps, Williams has joined fellow south Londoners Charlton, while Puncheon has moved to Huddersfield on loan until the end of the season.

Gent had been open in their interest of Sorloth, with manager Jess Thorup commenting on speculation at the weekend.

'I saw that he played on Saturday. (Laughs) Bad news,' he told reporters. 'He has power, pace and can hopefully score some goals. That's what we need.'

For Palace, meanwhile, the search for reinforcements goes on. The Eagles were in for both Dominic Solanke and Michy Batshuayi, before talks fell through.

Everton's Oumar Niasse has also been linked, and sporting director Dougie Freedman is working hard to get an attacking player through the door before the deadline.

item.title: Chelsea make Cesc Fabregas wait to complete Monaco move as they search for midfield replacement with Nicolo Barella and Leandro Paredes targeted
item.description: The Spanish midfielder was in tears as he made a lap of honour to applaud the fans after the FA Cup third round win over Nottingham Forest, as he prepares to move to Monaco.
item.content:encoded:
Cesc Fabregas is still a Chelsea player despite his emotional goodbye on Saturday, as the club want to sign a replacement before letting him leave.

The Spanish midfielder was in tears as he made a lap of honour to applaud the fans after the FA Cup third round win over Nottingham Forest, as he prepares to move to Monaco.

A contract has already been agreed between Fabregas and the Ligue 1 club, however he has returned to training at Cobham as his move is delayed.


Chelsea are hoping to conclude a deal for either Cagliari's Nicolo Barella or Leandro Paredes of Zenit Saint Petersburg before the end of the week - and will not let Fabregas go before then.

Blues manager Maurizio Sarri has told his club they must sign a replacement for Fabregas this month.

Fabregas, who won two Premier League titles with Chelsea, has agreed a three-and-half year deal at Monaco, however a free transfer deal in the summer is also in place should no replacement be signed this month.

According to L'Equipe, Fabregas has already had a photo shoot at Monaco for his unveiling by the club, and a medical was penciled in for Monday until Chelsea delayed the transfer.

Allowing Fabregas to join Monaco immediately - even on a free - would save Chelsea around £10million in wages and bonuses, however any quality replacement would not come cheap.

The Blues are said to be put off by Cagliari's £45m valuation of Barella, 21, who has been capped four times by his native Italy.

Cagliari's president has said he won't sell in January, however might change his mind if Chelsea match the asking price. Inter Milan and Napoli are also interested, with Napoli identifying him as a replacement for midfielder Alan, wanted by PSG.

Zenit would also command a tidy sum for Paredes, 24, having signed him for £20m in 2017. Paredes joined Empoli on loan from Roma as Sarri left for Napoli, meaning the Chelsea manager is very much a fan of the Argentine.

Fabregas, 31, has made just one Premier League start this season, and is unlikely to feature for Chelsea again with his future clearly away from Stamford Bridge.

Sarri said on Monday: 'In my opinion, he needs to go. You know very well the situation. He has an offer for two years. I don't want a very important player as Cesc unhappy.'
